BSCcore
Class FileBSCModel

java.lang.Object
  BSCcore.BSCModel
      BSCcore.FileBSCModel

public class FileBSCModel
extends BSCModel

Allows BiSciCol models to be created directly from RDF text files.

Constructor Detail

FileBSCModel

public FileBSCModel(java.lang.String file,
                    com.hp.hpl.jena.ontology.OntModelSpec ont)
             throws java.lang.Exception
Construct a new FileBSCModel from the text RDF data at the specified file URI and the given ontology model description. Guess the language from file URI extension defaulting to "N3".

Parameters:
file - The URI of the RDF file to load.
ont - A Jena ontology model description.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

Construct a new FileBSCModel from the text RDF data (in the specified language) at the specified file URI and the given ontology model description.

Parameters:
file - The URI of the RDF file to load.
lang - The language of the RDF data (N3, RDF/XML, etc.).
ont - A Jena ontology model description.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
Method Detail

loadFile

public void loadFile(java.lang.String file,
                     java.lang.String lang)
              throws java.lang.Exception
Read text RDF data and load it into the model. Before parsing the RDF data, this method will first attempt to verify that the file contains a valid UTF-8 character stream and throws an exception if it does not. This test is necessary because it appears that the Jena code that handles reading Turtle and N3 data files does not properly handle UTF-8 stream errors. When a UTF-8 error is encountered, the Jena code will silently fail and return an empty model as if the read had been successful.

Parameters:
file - The URI of the RDF file to load.
lang - The language of the RDF data (N3, RDF/XML, etc.).
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
